name: Doi Suthep Training Loop
description:
This loop is safe and fast for an everyday routine. You can take a Grab Bike to the start point. It’s important to run it clockwise to avoid paying the entrance fee. You’ll see the post while running downhill.

- There is a cafe for breakfast before or after the workout.
- There is also a 7-Eleven not far from the start, so you can get drinks after each loop.

name: Doi Pha Sam Liam loop
description: Hire a private car for 2,500 THB to reach the starting point. I hiked it anti-clockwise and spent a lot of time descending to the waterfall; I would recommend going clockwise instead. Beware of dogs — some of them are not friendly! There is a village where you can buy drinks and instant noodles. The forest near the top is so quiet and beautiful; if the weather is good, you can see a perfect view of Chiang Dao mountain.

name: Two Peaks: Doi Pui Summit and Doi Suthep
description: Take a Grab to the starting point. The temple's parking is open from 6 AM to 9 PM, if I'm not mistaken. There is a village with multiple coffee shops and a visitor center with a campsite where you can buy drinks and food.

name: Sai Yoi Waterfall
description: I used to hike here before an entry fee was introduced. Start from Basecamp Coffee and head toward Doi Suthep Temple. There, you can take a rest, grab a drink, or have a meal before continuing along a less-traveled path to the waterfall. The trail is no easy, so please be careful.
